meanings.definition: A type of flatworm belonging to the class Turbellaria.
meanings.sent1: In science class, we learned about planarians and their flat bodies.
meanings.sent2: The pond was teeming with planarians, tiny flatworms wriggling in the water.
meanings.sent3: The planarians in the lake were having a party, dancing with their flat bodies.
meanings.sent4: The field looked like a sea of planarians, each one a tiny flat ribbon on the ground.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the sight of the planarians, their flat bodies moving gracefully in the water.

meanings.definition: Organisms that are typically found in freshwater environments.
meanings.sent1: Planarians thrive in freshwater habitats, where they can be seen gliding along.
meanings.sent2: The biologist studied the ecosystem, focusing on the role of planarians in freshwater.
meanings.sent3: The planarians in the river were enjoying a leisurely swim in the freshwater.
meanings.sent4: The lake shimmered with life, teeming with colorful fish and graceful planarians.
meanings.sent5: The children marveled at the planarians, wondering how they thrived in the freshwater environment.

meanings.definition: Planarians are known for their regenerative abilities.
meanings.sent1: After being cut in half, planarians can regenerate into two separate worms.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the genetic makeup of planarians to understand their regenerative powers.
meanings.sent3: The planarians at the lab were playing a game of tag, regenerating each time they were caught.
meanings.sent4: The garden seemed magical, with planarians regenerating like tiny wizards of nature.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the planarians regenerate was like watching a miracle of nature unfold before my eyes.
